Candidate   Nattapong Pongboot    
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Bangkok, Thailand  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
M.Eng.(ChE), Kasetsart University, Thailand 2010 – 2012  
B.Eng.(ChE), Kasetsart University, Thailand 2005 – 2009  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
July 2020 – Present  
Position: Independent Consultant, Self -Employed, Bangkok, Thailand  
Responsibilities: Support customers in the energy sector  
Projects:  
Mainly provide consultancy via Global R&D ( https://www.globalrd.co.th/ )  
• Catalyst consulting (a global hydrocracking catalyst manufacturer) – as a consultant for catalyst 
loading scheme design  
• Catalyst consulting (a global  hydrotreating catalyst manufacturer) – as a consultant for catalyst 
loading scheme design  
• Investigation of cooling water system failure during project commissioning (a new olefins plant) 
– as a lead investigator  
• Pilot Plant Design Guideline (Research Organization) – as a co -project leader and the lead 
author  
 
Technical Training:  
• Provide technical trainings with http://www.chemengedu.com/  
• Refining and Petrochemical Processes: Essential Knowledge for People in the Chemical 
Industry (CR Asia) – with the main focus on reactor, catalyst, a nd adsorbent  
• Understanding Process Equipment for Efficient Operation & Monitoring, Maintenance, and 
Troubleshooting (HMC Polymer)  
• Process Equipment & Operation Problem Solving, and Troubleshooting (GE Power) – with the 
main focus on combined -cycle powe r plant  
 
September 2019 – June 2020 Honeywell UOP  Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  
Position: Senior Technical Advisor  
Responsibilities:  
Travel led worldwide to customer sites and provided technical support of new process unit startups, 
turnarounds, revamps, troubleshooting, and optimization across a range of refining and petrochemical 
technologies.  
  
Projects:  
• Diesel Hydrotreater (IOCL, Panipat, India): Reactor inspection and catalyst loading  
• Naphtha/Kerosene/Diesel Hydrotreater and Mild Hydrocracker (ADNOC, Abu Dhabi, UAE) : 
Reactor inspection, catalyst reloading, sulfiding, and startup  
 
March 2019 – August 2019  SCG Chemicals, Rayong, Thailand  
Position: Lead Process Technology Engineer  
Responsibilities: performed techno -economic study of various technologies, including FCC -based 
naphtha cracker, mixed C4s value -adding, and crude to chemicals.  
 
January 2013 – February 2019 PTT Global Chemical, Rayong, Thailand  
Position: Refinery Process Engineer  
Responsibilities:  
Plant operation, plant improvement, equipment inspection, and model ling/simulatio n  
 
Hydrocracker (Shell)  
Key achievements:  
• Initiated the new production strategies to utilize low -cost hydrogen within PTTGC to improve the 
volume swell of both diesel hydrotreater and hydrocracker by re -evaluating the sulfur target of 
diesel product and n ew catalyst selection strategy. PetroSIM was used as a simulation tool for 
this feasibility study. He was an integral part of this transformation with estimated margin uplift 
of 20+ MM$/year.  
• Developed effective fractionator tuning and product blending t echniques to improve the cetane 
number of hydrocracked diesel to improve sales volume of premium diesel by 50%.  
• First Hydrocracker Engineer who implemented pilot plant test for hydrocracking catalyst 
selection with execution and interpretation methodolog y developed. hte GmbH was selected as 
an independent pilot plant testing company. This practice is now the new standard for modern 
hydrocracking catalyst selection in PTTGC.  
• Modified hydrocracker fractionator so it can additionally recover 2% more heavy naphtha (if 
required).  
• Leaded major projects, from basic to detailed design, such as:  
1. Diesel rundown capacity debottleneck, 20% additional diesel draw  
2. Hydrocracker feed preheating, 10 degC additional feed temperature  
3. Wash water capacity debottle neck, 30% additional wash water to the problematic area  
4. CDU overhead compression debottlenecking with estimated fuel saving by 2% at the 
crude heater.  
 
Power Plant and Utilities  
Key achievements:  
• Gas turbine downtime reduction by 50% by air filter upgr ading.  
• Water transfer syste

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
